description:
Job details
No matching job preferences
Pay
From $23.08 an hour
Job Type
Full-time
An exciting career awaits you
At MPC, we’re committed to being a great place to work – one that welcomes new ideas, encourages diverse perspectives, develops our people, and fosters a collaborative team environment.
Overview:
Marathon Petroleum Company LP (MPC) offers internship and co-op opportunities to high-performing college students who want meaningful hands-on experiences in their fields of study. The following core values guide MPC’s approach to doing business: Safety & Environmental Stewardship, Integrity, Respect, Inclusion, and Collaboration. Interns and co-ops work side by side with experienced professionals as contributing members of diverse work teams who create value for the company’s shareholders. MPC believes that how we conduct our business is just as important as the bottom line.
Responsibilities:
A co-op/internship with MPC Information Technology can provide you the valued experience needed to work in today’s competitive working environment while delivering efficient and innovative solutions.
MPC ITS offers a diverse set of opportunities which gives you exposure to different areas of our business. With the potential to have multiple sessions and opportunities, you will gain valuable real-world experience while enhancing your skill set in one or more of the following IT job positions:
Business Analyst:
This position is an opportunity to play a significant role in supporting the technology needs of the Marathon business units. This role emphasizes Business Analysis and Project Management. Work directly with internal business partners and the IT Services team to identify areas to create and deliver value-added IT solutions. Job responsibilities could include:
Collaborate with a diverse team of IT Developers and IT Business Analysts to ensure solutions are implemented in a manner consistent with the MPC software development lifecycle.
Gather requirements and translate them into functional specifications. Active participation in the testing process to ensure a quality product is delivered.
Understand the security and compliance requirements of applications and business areas.
Utilize appropriate methods, controls, and documentation.
Contribute and assist in assignments in a team environment.
Clearly communicate thoughts, ideas, specifications, and requirements with business clients and technical developers using appropriate means of communication.
Applications Developer:
The IT Developer will design, build, and support solutions in a team-focused, collaborative environment that includes contributions from developer peers, architectural guidance from architects, and business requirements from business analysts. Job responsibilities could include:
Understand how the technical landscape supports business operations and identify the best technologies to support business needs, including automation.
Develop and maintain architectural guidelines and coding standards to ensure solutions are reliable, - sustainable, and scalable.
Contribute to a healthy team environment, collaborating with various organizations across IT, including analytics, database management, and peer developers/analysts as appropriate.
Ensure solutions are implemented in a manner consistent with Solution Delivery and MPC corporate policies and IT standards, utilizing appropriate methods, controls, and documentation.
Clearly communicate thoughts, specifications, requirements, and progress with business partners and peers.
Cybersecurity Analysts:
Cybersecurity Analysts supports the business in a variety of functions including risk assessments, cybersecurity administration of gateway, endpoint and cloud solutions, event detection and response, vulnerability management, and penetration testing. The role can provide an opportunity to engage with a variety of teams where job responsibilities could include:
Monitoring and analysis of cybersecurity events
Handling and escalation of Indicators of Compromise (IOC)
Administration and management of gateway, endpoint, and cloud security solutions
Vulnerability scanning and remediation prioritization
Understand Advanced Persistent Threats (APT) and Tactics, Techniques, and Procedures (TTP) and how to replicate attack methodology.
Facilitate maintenance of Cybersecurity, policies/standards providing training, guidance, and recommendations to meet requirements and address gaps.
Identify and monitor cybersecurity risks across internal, cloud, and vendor environments.
Analytics & Innovation:
The Data Development team will design, build, and support data solutions in a team-focused, collaborative environment that includes contributions from Data Scientists, Business Intelligence Developers, Data Engineers, Data Integrations and Robotic Process Automation developer peers, architectural guidance from architects, data governance and security guidance and business requirements from business analysts. Job responsibilities could include:
Supporting the department in transforming raw data into actionable insights
Build and make changes to reporting solutions based on business requirements
Real-world data engineering experience, using state-of-the-art tools and technologies.
Real-world experience working on projects in a typical Data Science or Analytics environment, using state-of-the-art tools and technologies, while gaining broad exposure to the oil and gas industry.
Programming for custom data ingestion, model development and testing, analyzing data, and writing documentation.
Daily activities may include writing high quality queries to retrieve and analyze complex datasets, building insightful dashboards, researching and developing statistical learning models for data analysis and effectively communicating results across stakeholder groups
Cloud Infrastructure Engineer:
This transformation position is responsible for providing operational and technical support for refinery server and/or cloud environments by working collaboratively with multi-disciplinary workgroups to seek solutions to problems. This role would work on efforts which result in improved value of infrastructure services. Job responsibilities could include:
Perform server, cloud, workstation, and/or network administration. Server and workstation administration are primarily on Microsoft Windows OS, SQL servers, with some occasional Linux administration. Network administration is on switches, routers, and firewall devices. Cloud administration is on Azure Cloud Services.
Monitor system health and identify issues using common industry toolsets.
Problem tracking, management, and resolution of issues
Learn, understand, and apply Marathon Standard Practices to Information Technology assets.
Identify, analyze, and elevate potential Cybersecurity events according to company procedures.
Daily activities may include system backup administration, anti-virus administration, performance tuning, Microsoft Active Directory administration, network security detection administration, administration of the physical IP cabling and IP address assignments, updating of network diagrams, security policy management, data access controls, software patch management, risk management, change control administration, database administration, and self-auditing to ensure compliance with standards.
Test and deploy enterprise apps
Experience the power of cloud computing with Azure Virtual Machines, Managed Disks, and SQL databases while providing high availability and scalable performance with load-balanced Virtual Machine Scale Sets.
Create custom mobile experiences
Build based on your customers’ interests and behaviors using Azure App Service and Azure Cosmos DB, Xamarin, and Traffic Manager.
Qualifications:
Desired Majors: Computer Science & Engineering; Computer Science & Engineering Technology; Management Information Systems; Computer Information Systems; Information Systems & Analytics; Computer Engineering; Software Engineering and Computer Science; and other related IT disciplines
Strong academic performance
Candidates must be authorized to work in the US on a full-time indefinite basis without the need for employment visa sponsorship now or in the future.
Positions are available for fall semester
Concurrent enrollment in a degree seeking program throughout duration of experience
Military experience a plus
Min - $23.08 per hour/Max - $26.92 per hour
We hire for the following locations:
Corporate: Findlay, OH, San Antonio. TX, Denver CO (Corporate Refining, Transportation & Logistics, Process Systems, and Supplier Diversity & Corporate Support)
Refineries (depending on semester): Canton, OH, Detroit, MI, Catlettsburg, KY; Garyville, LA; Robinson, IL; St. Paul Park, MN; Los Angeles, CA and Texas City, TX (Galveston Bay)
As an energy industry leader, our career opportunities fuel personal and professional growth.

A Human Resources representative will review your request and contact you to discuss a reasonable accommodation. Marathon Petroleum offers a total rewards program which includes, but is not limited to, access to health, vision, and dental insurance, paid time off, 401k matching program, paid parental leave, and educational reimbursement. Equal Opportunity Employer: Veteran / Disability

Job details
No matching job preferences
Pay
$48 an hour
Job Type
Internship
Parallel Systems is an early-stage startup company developing the future of intermodal transportation. Our mission is to decarbonize freight while improving supply chain logistics and safety. We are developing vehicles and software to create new autonomous and electric transportation systems for existing rail infrastructure.
At Parallel Systems, we value the team as much as the mission. We want to work with talented people who are humble, motivated, and persistent. Our most successful team members are self-starters and collaborate with others to reach our collective goals.

Join us in Los Angeles for an in-person software internship! You will be assigned a project and a mentor, and interact daily with fellow engineers to write code and design systems to be deployed in the real world.
As an intern, you'll be working on code to solve various challenges. These include: managing our autonomous fleet, identifying and reacting to hazards on the rail, validating our software stack, simulating the rail environment, planning and routing trains on the network, and much more!
We are looking for interns with experience in any of the following: Machine Learning/AI, Systems Software, Embedded/Firmware development, Test and Validation, Networking and Communications, Back-end services, React and web app development
Preferred language experience in Rust, C/C++, or Python.

Responsibilities
Architect and implement fleet management code. Encourage and maintain high standards for robustness and performance
Understand high level technical requirements, develop algorithms and software structures, and validate code in simulation
Design and build applications for real-time fleet operations, telemetry, and metrics
Develop vehicle code to interact with off-board services
Collaborate with autonomy, mapping, and hardware engineers
Work closely with multi-disciplinary engineering teams.
Basic Qualifications
Currently enrolled in a full-time program working towards a bachelors, masters or PhD in computer science or a related engineering field
Experience with software development, in Python, C, C++, Rust or equivalent system language
Preferred Qualifications
Experience with distributed systems, such as multi-region cloud infrastructure.
Experience with software development teamwork skills including the use of version control systems (git), project scheduling (Jira or similar), code review
Experience writing robust code for vehicles or autonomous devices
Experience writing high performance, low latency software, such as kernel code, real-time code
Experience with automated testing on pure software and hybrid hardware/software testbeds

$38/hour to $48 /hour
Please note the national salary range listed in the job posting reflects the new hire salary range across levels that would be applicable to the position. Final salary will be commensurate with the candidate's final level. Also, this range represents base salary only and does not include equity or benefits, if applicable.
Parallel Systems is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to any discriminatory factor protected by applicable federal, state or local laws. We work to build an inclusive environment in which all people can come to do their best work.
Parallel Systems is committed to the full inclusion of all qualified individuals. As part of this commitment, Parallel Systems will ensure that persons with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact your recruiter.
